compliant.section:
2. Retention of Your Personal Data
We will retain your personal data for the period necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law for other necessary purposes. For example, we may retain your personal data for an adequate and reasonable period for customer relationship management purposes; to comply with tax law or other laws and regulations, we may retain your personal data for the period required by such laws and regulations; to comply with requests from government or judicial authorities for purposes such as an investigation or lawsuit, we may retain your personal data for a longer retention period. In addition, if you wish to withdraw your previous consent to our collection of your personal data, we will stop collecting your personal data based on your request and will only retain your personal data collected before the withdrawal.
compliant.legal provisions: Data minimization principle: Personal data shall be kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed;

non_compliant.legal provisions: Right to be informed of recipients: The controller shall provide the data subject with information about ... the recipients or categories of recipient to whom the personal data have been or will be disclosed.
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly identify the categories of recipients with whom personal data may be shared, such as service providers, business partners, or public authorities. Vague terms like "third parties" are insufficient.
